title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act may be cited as the "Economic Development Information Act of 1997". It includes findings and declarations. Congress finds that accurate and timely information on economic development programs is crucial for maintaining the national economy and addressing unemployment and underemployment in various regions and communities. Congress acknowledges the importance of accurate economic development information for maintaining the national economy and addressing unemployment in different regions and communities. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have successfully assisted communities affected by military or Department of Energy closures and defense-related industry downsizing. Congress declares the need to expand economic development information to assist areas suffering from economic distress or long-term deterioration, providing access to various government and economic resources. Congress declares the need to expand economic development information to assist areas suffering from economic distress or long-term deterioration by providing access to government and economic resources. This information should be easily accessible and useful for those seeking economic development purposes. The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section, SEC. 605, which establishes the Office of Economic Development Information. This office aims to provide easily accessible and useful information to areas in need of economic development resources. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information clearinghouse for economic development programs and assist applicants in locating and applying for assistance. The Office of Economic Development Information will help applicants find and apply for economic development assistance under Federal, State, and local laws, including financial and technical assistance. It will also develop electronic links to information databases to assist in identifying and applying for resources under economic development programs. The Office of Economic Development Information will develop electronic links to databases with information on available economic development programs of the Federal Government, including key contacts and application process details. The Office of Economic Development Information will provide relevant information on economic development programs of the Federal Government, State, and local governments, including key contacts, application process details, eligibility requirements, economic data, and trends. The Office of Economic Development Information offers details on governmental economic development programs, economic data and trends, case studies, best practices, and technology utilization programs. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources on economic development, adjustment, technology utilization programs, case studies, best practices, and finance programs related to economic development objectives. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources on revolving loan fund programs, finance programs, sources of capital for businesses, sustainable development initiatives, and public access to data services. The Office of Economic Development Information ensures public access to data services through an easily accessible information clearinghouse, including an Internet website with key locations sorted for user-friendliness. The Office of Economic Development Information provides public access to data services through an Internet website, toll-free telephone number, and online electronic access. The Office of Economic Development Information offers public access through a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation materials, workshops, and information specialists for person-to-person assistance. Coordination with other federal departments and agencies is also required. The Office of Economic Development Information provides public access through various means, including on-call information specialists for person-to-person assistance. The Secretary is required to coordinate with other federal departments and agencies to achieve the objectives of this section. Economic development is defined to include economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
